intro: Phryganocydia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco grass螟, is a species of moth found in South America. It belongs to the family Geometridae, which includes geometer moths. The plant is characterized by its fibrous, grass-like appearance and is often found in dry, open habitats. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various herbivorous insects. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
